channel.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
channel.description:
i`ve started working on my first hammer map for tf2,nothing serious,just a fun,unbalanced fight arena for 6v6 or less,and in the middle of the map,there`s water,but i can`t get it to appear,so if any member of this forum is kind enough to diagnose the problem,i would be very grateful i`m still working on ramps and a little elevator to get on the top of each spawn,and there will be a simple bridge above the water. feel free to suggest on ways to make it more fun ![](upload://nINQR17gUNglQSFmnlcbBs6NVl1.jpeg)
here is the link to the vmf [url='https://www.mediafire.com/?5cnf6jxchxwsh6c']the almighty map[/url]

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Maxey:

Making water for HL1 was much easier. Dunno why Valve changed that.

No its not. Nodraw brush, apply water to one side, check for leaks. I only read OP and some subsequent posts, but I can almost guarantee there is a leak or VVIS isn’t running properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Stuntz
item.description:
No, a rectangle is a square. He means it can’t be cylinder shaped, or anything else of that sort. Also what leaks are is when anything withing the map is exposed to the void. So it’s always best to compile your map and do the load pointfile, to be safe!

EDIT: And yes, if the water is touching the void it will cause a leak.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
JeffMOD:

Also, water MUST be square- you can’t make the surface any other shape.

so to fill the “river” in the middle of my map i will have to make several water squares?

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Zeus
item.description:
Goddammit guise, it’s spelled APOSTROPHE

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: nunzilla
item.description:
You should try using “ur” instead, to avoid confusion, and also, to make yourself out to be a total douche nozzle.

You can use it to replace “your” in this phrase:

You can use it to replace “you’re” too, for example:

As mentioned above, it will make you seem like a tool, but at least no trolls will pounce on you for your grammar.

Oh, and UR welcome.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Also, don’t put multiple heights of water in the same visleaf, or one of them will render incorrectly.
EDIT: That may or may not cause a leak, but you want the edges to be flush with the inside edges of the walls.
Also, water MUST be square- you can’t make the surface any other shape.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
SaintCheshireDeath:

To the OP:

I second what Spycrabz said. I can’t put enough emphasis on the importance of checking for leaks. If you haven’t already done so, read up on finding leaks. My Hammer doesn’t display an error message when a leak is detected (at least not by default,) so you may want to try loading a pointfile and see what happens. If you go to load a pointfile and Hammer asks you if you want to load the default pointfile, that means that there was some kind of leak. AFAIK, this dialog will appear unless the map is leak-free.

i do not think there are,because i double checked the impossibility of the players to get out of the map,however,i did extend the water a bit further than the walls that keep the player outside of the void,would that count as a leak??

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: SaintCheshireDeath
item.description:
To the OP:

I second what Spycrabz said. I can’t put enough emphasis on the importance of checking for leaks. If you haven’t already done so, read up on finding leaks. My Hammer doesn’t display an error message when a leak is detected (at least not by default,) so you may want to try loading a pointfile and see what happens. If you go to load a pointfile and Hammer asks you if you want to load the default pointfile, that means that there was some kind of leak. AFAIK, this dialog will appear unless the map is leak-free.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

I don’t recall saying I was attempting to be humorous, though I guess I might’ve had the tone. Not on purpose, you understand.

Also, and I feel like a colossal dick just typing this:
It’s you’re, not your.

I know its irritating but I’m on the internet I don’t really give a fuck about grammar I don’t even try sometimes I do out of habit but most of the time I type whatever version is fastest not best.

Although admittedly it bugs the hell out of me when people don’t get this right https://www.wsu.edu/~brians/errors/group.html I am so tired of seeing “Valve are”

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

you 're commas and apostraphes in the right place and, capitalize properly

i am not commas and apostraphes

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
I apologize if I’m coming off as a troll, and I promise I’ll drop the subject after this post.

However, a quick skim through the wikihow article doesn’t seem to contradict me.

“When you are (also works with you’re) trying to point out flaws in grammar don’t have them in your statement.” That seems to work fine, instead of SURPLUS_NiNjA’s use of your.

I guess you looked at the wrong ‘your?’

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

I don’t recall saying I was attempting to be humorous, though I guess I might’ve had the tone. Not on purpose, you understand.

Also, and I feel like a colossal dick just typing this:
It’s you’re, not your.

is it just me or the forums are having an influx of trolls lately?

as for your grammar problem
www.wikihow.com/Use-You’re-and-Your

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

That was the point.

I was trying to be clever and maybe even mocking.
I guess I failed.

Here’s a tip, when your trying to point out flaws in grammar don’t have them in your statement. Being clever about it isn’t going to put the forum in stitches from laughter.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice

I guess I failed.

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Spycrabz
item.description:
You need to nodraw all sides except the top, choose a proper water texture, and make sure your map has no leaks.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

“learn how to put you’re commas and apostraphes”

It is still grammatically incorrect.

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
Maxey:

You also wrote “you’re commas” instead of “your”.

Don’t throw stones if your roof is made of glass.

“learn how to put you’re commas and apostraphes”

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Take a brush, make it where you want the water to be. Texture it with no draw. Then using the face edit tool edit the top only to a water texture.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Rollofthedice
item.description:
felipedomaul:

OUCH,that was a true grammar fail.
i have the flu,so im a little drousy,cant think straight.
about the apostrophes,my keyboard is brazilian,so i don`t want to reach for the distant apostrophe every 5 words so i use the more convenient Grave accent key.

Fair enough. I won’t be too much of an ass.
The first sentence was mimicking you, by the way.
Also:

Rollofthedice:

apostraphes

COUNTER GRAMMAR POLICE BITCH!

Yes, because one mistake is so much worse than two whole posts of problems. Not to mention I was being mocking.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
Rollofthedice:

how about you,learn how to,you know,put you 're commas and apostraphes in the right place and, capitalize properly

I mean, come on. Just take a few minutes to look over your typing and to correct it. It’s not very hard.

To address the original post: No idea. I don’t even work with game engines/SDK’s.

OUCH,that was a true grammar fail.
i have the flu,so im a little drousy,cant think straight.
about the apostrophes,my keyboard is brazilian,so i don`t want to reach for the distant apostrophe every 5 words so i use the more convenient Grave accent key.

QUOTE=Rollofthedice;280016]apostraphes
[/QUOTE]
COUNTER GRAMMAR POLICE BITCH!

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
Not to mention that only the top of the water brush should be textured, the other faces should be nodrawed.

Read full topic

item.title: Water,Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Did you select a water texture? I remember that part being important, otherwise it’d be some sort of invisible water.

Read full topic
